prefix: "Conservation" means all activities to preserve and rehabilitate forests, in particular activities designed to protect or restore the biological diversity and ecological functions of the forest ecosystem
reference: , while securing as far as possible their current and future value for mankind and in particular for forest-dependent people.
text: . In particular, it is defined as a means of maintaining the genetic diversity and diversity of protected species. These uses are primarily aimed at controlling the survival and development of protected species. The protection of priority species is the use of reproductive material such as reproductive material for the purposes of restoring agricultural production, multifunctional and sustainable agriculture, and the maintenance of ecological balance. These uses may include the maintenance of natural habitats and the protection of sedentary species. These may also include the provision of reproductive material for the benefit of certain species. The use of reproductive material for the purpose of preserving the ecological balance is limited to protection and maintenance of the forest ecosystem.
phrases: and the maintenance of ecological balance.
